30X.F.summary: Crayon Group Holding ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates as an IT advisory company in software and digital transformation services. It operates through Software & Cloud Direct, Software & Cloud Channel, Software & Cloud Economics, and Consulting segments. The company offers license management and consultancy services; SAM as a Service, a single hosted managed service that enables its clients to control software and technology assets across their IT environment; and SAM-iQ, which provides a centralized program interface that allows its customers to analyze, review, and manage their SAM environment. It also provides software and cloud economic services, including license management and solutions across large and mid-market enterprises, public sector, and cloud and service provider markets, as well as deployment planning services. In addition, the company offers consulting services in the areas of cloud architecture and deployment solutions, licensing environment optimization and management, security, datacenter systems, infrastructure and networking, backup and data recovery, servers environments, and storage and virtualization solutions; and managed services, such as outsourced license lifecycle management, project management, audit simulation and support, and infrastructure management and support services. Further, it provides training, events, and development programs for IT professionals. The company has operations in the Nordics, Europe, the Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and Africa, and the United States. The company has a strategic collaboration agreement with Amazon Web Services. Crayon Group Holding ASA is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

4NK.F.summary: Norbit ASA provides technology products and solutions in Norway and internationally. The company offers monitoring and detection services for maritime, and offshore oil and gas projects; consultancy services; sensors and systems for monitoring, detection, and reporting tasks; and SeaCOP software system for monitoring, detection, and emergency response for maritime and offshore operations. Its products include DSRC 2G, a short range communication device; VTM 745, a DSRC module for enforcement in GNSS based tolling; connectivity modules for smart tachographs; desktop readers; road side units; and reclosable fasteners. In addition, the company is involved in the provision of electronic manufacturing services, such as pure circuit board assembly, cable and wire harness, and fabrication of products and systems; and original design manufacturing services under the NORBIT brand. Norbit ASA was founded in 1980 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

4W9.F.summary: Pexip Holding ASA, a technology company that delivers a video-first meeting platform. Its platform simplifies video communication across borders, businesses, and platforms, enabling everyone to be seen, heard, and included. The company offers self-hosted and as-a-service deployment options for enterprise video conferencing built on the Pexip Infinity technology; and provides interoperability, including Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business, Google Hangouts Gateway interop, video system device registration, and a world-class meeting and calling service. The company has operations in the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas. Pexip Holding ASA was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ARR.OL.summary: Arribatec Solutions ASA, a software and consulting company, provides digital business solutions in Norway and internationally. Its solutions include Unit4 that provides services for driving digitalization in platforms to deliver digital experiences; xledger, a cloud based ERP system; Hypergene that provides enterprise performance management services ; 4human, a software as a solution that delivers HRM solutions to corporate business, government and public services, retail, education, museums, construction, and other sectors; Power BI, a collection of tools and services that facilitates the acquisition of data, data modeling, visualizations, and reports, as well as the distribution of analytical solutions; RamBase, cloud based ERP solution for manufacturing and wholesale industries; Arribatec Instipro3, a research platform; and Arribatec Certify, an application for daily management of housekeeping department, including digitalized cleanliness, as well as inspection processes for rooms, and public and exhibition areas. The company was founded in 2015 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ATEA.OL.summary: Atea ASA supplies IT infrastructure and related solutions for businesses and public sector organizations in the Nordic countries and Baltic regions. The company provides hardware and software solutions for storing and managing information, as well as tools for virtualization, automation, and security for operating the data center environment; client hardware, software, and services to the requirements of users, applications, security, networks, and computing environments. It also offers hardware and software solutions for running networks, and services to help customers manage their communications; and a range of products to enable collaboration through conferencing, information sharing, and digital productivity solutions. In addition, it provides Device as a Service to various concepts, such as videoconferencing, digital signage, and networks. Atea ASA was founded in 1968 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

AYFIE.OL.summary: ayfie Group AS, a search company, provides knowledge discovery products and search solutions in the Nordics, Europe, and the United States. Its products are based on artificial intelligence enhanced solutions built on proprietary linguistics, machine learning, smart search, and text analytics. The company offers search and text analytics solutions for legal, compliance, finance, healthcare, and media. Its platform includes technologies from the fields of big data, insight engines, linguistic analysis, and content analytics. The company also provides text analytics solutions for eDiscovery, finance, publishing, and compliance. Its products include Locator for Knowledge Management that helps customers turn their corporate data into a true knowledge resource; Inspector that helps lawyers and others involved in litigation and investigations to identify the data important for their cases; and Document Analyzer that reads collections of documents to extract key information. The company's products are used by various industries ranging from construction companies to professional soccer clubs; and messaging and feature development focuses on serving law firms and legal service providers, as well as legal departments in corporations. It also offers service desk and knowledge base services. The company is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

B1T.F.summary: Techstep ASA provides digital workplace services in Norway and Sweden. It offers mobile hardware, service, support, and mobility consultancy services; and software as a service telecom expense management modules. The company also provides industry-leading cloud-based PBX solutions and enterprise mobility management services, including mobile security, system design, implementation, and mobile device management. Techstep ASA is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

B7Z.F.summary: Arribatec Solutions ASA, a software and consulting company, provides digital business solutions in Norway and internationally. Its solutions include Unit4 that provides services for driving digitalization in platforms to deliver digital experiences; xledger, a cloud based ERP system; Hypergene that provides enterprise performance management services ; 4human, a software as a solution that delivers HRM solutions to corporate business, government and public services, retail, education, museums, construction, and other sectors; Power BI, a collection of tools and services that facilitates the acquisition of data, data modeling, visualizations, and reports, as well as the distribution of analytical solutions; RamBase, cloud based ERP solution for manufacturing and wholesale industries; Arribatec Instipro3, a research platform; and Arribatec Certify, an application for daily management of housekeeping department, including digitalized cleanliness, as well as inspection processes for rooms, and public and exhibition areas. The company was founded in 2015 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

BOUV.OL.summary: Bouvet ASA provides information technology, digital communication, and enterprise management services in Norway, Sweden, and internationally. The company designs, develops, and provides advisory services on IT solutions and digital communication. Bouvet ASA was founded in 2002 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

CRAYN.OL.summary: Crayon Group Holding ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates as an IT advisory company in software and digital transformation services. It operates through Software & Cloud Direct, Software & Cloud Channel, Software & Cloud Economics, and Consulting segments. The company offers license management and consultancy services; SAM as a Service, a single hosted managed service that enables its clients to control software and technology assets across their IT environment; and SAM-iQ, which provides a centralized program interface that allows its customers to analyze, review, and manage their SAM environment. It also provides software and cloud economic services, including license management and solutions across large and mid-market enterprises, public sector, and cloud and service provider markets, as well as deployment planning services. In addition, the company offers consulting services in the areas of cloud architecture and deployment solutions, licensing environment optimization and management, security, datacenter systems, infrastructure and networking, backup and data recovery, servers environments, and storage and virtualization solutions; and managed services, such as outsourced license lifecycle management, project management, audit simulation and support, and infrastructure management and support services. Further, it provides training, events, and development programs for IT professionals. The company has operations in the Nordics, Europe, the Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and Africa, and the United States. The company has a strategic collaboration agreement with Amazon Web Services. Crayon Group Holding ASA is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

CYVIZ.OL.summary: Cyviz AS manufactures and sells products for conference rooms, control rooms and experience centers. The company offers Easy platform, a comprehensive platform for room control and management; and Easy server application that offers remote management, support, configuration, diagnosing, and software upgrades. It also provides Easy controller software on the touch controller unit; control system that orchestrates the underlying technology and integrates industry standard components and services for interoperability across Enterprise favored video- and unified communication platforms; and Easy Connect that allows to connect and share content, as well as display solutions. The company was incorporated in 1992 and is based in Sandnes, Norway.

ELABS.OL.summary: Elliptic Laboratories A/S provides software-based artificial intelligence (AI) virtual smart sensors in Norway, China, South Korea, the United States, and Japan. It offers AI virtual sensors, such as security, inner beauty proximity, gesture; presence, and connection sensors for laptops, mobiles, and IoT and VR devices. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

ELIMP.OL.summary: ElektroimportÃ¸ren AS engages in the wholesale and retail distribution of electrical goods. The company was incorporated in 1994 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

ELOP.OL.summary: Elop AS designs and develops smart products and solutions for the inspection, asset management, and structural health monitoring of concrete structures. It offers Cobri, a tool that gathers assessment data on critical infrastructure such as bridges, tunnels, and buildings and provides it to owners of critical concrete infrastructure. The company was founded in 2013 and is based in Hamar, Norway.

HSCNF.summary: House Of Control Group AS develops and sells software as a service solutions. The company offers Complete Control, a solution which is used for managing contracts and assets, including the contracts' financial implications for accounting, budgeting, and reporting. It also provides solution for assisting companies in complying with IFRS 16 requirements. The company is based in HÃ¸vik, Norway.

HUDL.OL.summary: Huddlestock Fintech As, a financial technology company, provides end-to-end asset management solutions. It offers digital onboarding, and real-time trading and updates. The company is based in Stavanger, Norway.

IDXAF.summary: IDEX Biometrics ASA engages in the design, development, and sale of fingerprint identification and authentication solutions in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, and Asia. The company offers IDEX Biometrics for the biometrics smart card market, including biometric fingerprint sensors for use in dual interface, contactless only, and contact only smart cards; biometric fingerprint modules for contact based smart cards; and on-card enrollment solutions for remote in-person enrollment. It primarily serves biometric payment card market, as well as offers its products and solutions for other markets, including access control, identification, healthcare, and the Internet of Things. The company was formerly known as Idex ASA and changed its name to IDEX Biometrics ASA in May 2019. IDEX Biometrics ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

INFRO.OL.summary: Infront ASA provides market data and trading solutions for financial professionals primarily in Europe. The company operates Infront Solutions and Terminal; Vwd Group; and News and Other segments. Its Infront terminal products, which offer real-time market data, trading, news, and analytics for financial market participants. The company also provides data and feed, portfolio management and advisory, and regulatory compliance, as well as publication and distribution solutions. Infront ASA was founded in 1998 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

ITERA.OL.summary: Itera ASA, together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, and operates digital solutions for companies and organizations in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Slovakia, and Ukraine. It delivers projects and services in the consulting and strategy, design and development, and operations and management areas. The company also provides strategic advisory, design and development, and managed cloud services, as well as hosting and operations, and infrastructure services. It primarily serves clients in insurance, banking and finance, high tech, energy, media, and public sectors. Itera ASA was founded in 1989 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

KAHOOT-ME.OL.summary: Kahoot! AS operates a game-based learning platform in Norway, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Finland. Its platforms help to create, share, and play learning games. The company has approximately 1.2 billion participating players in approximately 200 countries. Kahoot has partnership with Zoom Video Communications, Inc. to offer the Kahoot! app for Zoom, enabling its users to access, host and play Kahoot! games directly from Zoom Meetings. Kahoot! AS was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

KAHOT.OL.summary: Kahoot! AS operates a game-based learning platform in Norway, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Finland. Its platforms help to create, share, and play learning games. The company has approximately 1.2 billion participating players in approximately 200 countries. Kahoot has partnership with Zoom Video Communications, Inc. to offer the Kahoot! app for Zoom, enabling its users to access, host and play Kahoot! games directly from Zoom Meetings. Kahoot! AS was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

KHOTF.summary: Kahoot! AS operates a game-based learning platform in Norway, the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Finland. Its platforms help to create, share, and play learning games. The company has approximately 1.2 billion participating players in approximately 200 countries. Kahoot has partnership with Zoom Video Communications, Inc. to offer the Kahoot! app for Zoom, enabling its users to access, host and play Kahoot! games directly from Zoom Meetings. Kahoot! AS was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

MKL.F.summary: Atea ASA supplies IT infrastructure and related solutions for businesses and public sector organizations in the Nordic countries and Baltic regions. The company provides hardware and software solutions for storing and managing information, as well as tools for virtualization, automation, and security for operating the data center environment; client hardware, software, and services to the requirements of users, applications, security, networks, and computing environments. It also offers hardware and software solutions for running networks, and services to help customers manage their communications; and a range of products to enable collaboration through conferencing, information sharing, and digital productivity solutions. In addition, it provides Device as a Service to various concepts, such as videoconferencing, digital signage, and networks. Atea ASA was founded in 1968 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

MRCEL.OL.summary: Mercell Holding AS provides software platform for public e-tendering and procurement in the Nordic region. The company's software enables easy compliance with EU regulations for public buyers that are required by law to publish tenders through an e-tendering platform. Its two-sided SaaS marketplace platform also caters to the needs of the supply side and facilitates interaction between buyers and suppliers. The company also offers tender consulting services. Mercell Holding AS was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

NDCVF.summary: Nordic Semiconductor ASA, a fabless semiconductor company, designs, develops, and sells integrated circuits and related solutions for short and long range wireless communication in Europe, the Americas, and the Asia/Pacific. The company specializes in ultra-low power components, based on its proprietary 2.4 GHz RF, Bluetooth low energy, and LTE-M and NB- Internet of Things (IoT); and develops long power cellular IoT. It also provides Bluetooth 5 solutions; low power cellular devices for the IoT; and Bluetooth 5.1 solutions for direction finding applications. In addition, the company offers Zigbee 3.0 IoT solutions; Thread solution for low-power IEEE 802.15.4 devices; nRF52 and nRF51 series system-on-chips, and nRF5 software development kits; ANT, a proprietary ultra-low power wireless solution for battery operated products; and application specific integrated circuits and related consulting services. Further, it provides software for system development, communication stacks, and application layer software, as well as development tools for desktops, mobiles, and clouds. The company's products are used in various applications, such as audio and music, automotives, beacons, computer peripherals, connected health and homes, education, industrial automation, LED lightings, logistics and transport, retail and payment, sports and fitness, toys and gaming, virtual reality and augmented reality products, mobile phone accessories, and consumer electronics, as well as wearables, including connected watches, jewelry, proximity tags, and smart clothes and apparels. Nordic Semiconductor ASA was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

NOD.OL.summary: Nordic Semiconductor ASA, a fabless semiconductor company, designs, develops, and sells integrated circuits and related solutions for short and long range wireless communication in Europe, the Americas, and the Asia/Pacific. The company specializes in ultra-low power components, based on its proprietary 2.4 GHz RF, Bluetooth low energy, and LTE-M and NB- Internet of Things (IoT); and develops long power cellular IoT. It also provides Bluetooth 5 solutions; low power cellular devices for the IoT; and Bluetooth 5.1 solutions for direction finding applications. In addition, the company offers Zigbee 3.0 IoT solutions; Thread solution for low-power IEEE 802.15.4 devices; nRF52 and nRF51 series system-on-chips, and nRF5 software development kits; ANT, a proprietary ultra-low power wireless solution for battery operated products; and application specific integrated circuits and related consulting services. Further, it provides software for system development, communication stacks, and application layer software, as well as development tools for desktops, mobiles, and clouds. The company's products are used in various applications, such as audio and music, automotives, beacons, computer peripherals, connected health and homes, education, industrial automation, LED lightings, logistics and transport, retail and payment, sports and fitness, toys and gaming, virtual reality and augmented reality products, mobile phone accessories, and consumer electronics, as well as wearables, including connected watches, jewelry, proximity tags, and smart clothes and apparels. Nordic Semiconductor ASA was founded in 1983 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

NORBT.OL.summary: Norbit ASA provides technology products and solutions in Norway and internationally. The company offers monitoring and detection services for maritime, and offshore oil and gas projects; consultancy services; sensors and systems for monitoring, detection, and reporting tasks; and SeaCOP software system for monitoring, detection, and emergency response for maritime and offshore operations. Its products include DSRC 2G, a short range communication device; VTM 745, a DSRC module for enforcement in GNSS based tolling; connectivity modules for smart tachographs; desktop readers; road side units; and reclosable fasteners. In addition, the company is involved in the provision of electronic manufacturing services, such as pure circuit board assembly, cable and wire harness, and fabrication of products and systems; and original design manufacturing services under the NORBIT brand. Norbit ASA was founded in 1980 and is headquartered in Trondheim, Norway.

OPRA.summary: Opera Limited, together with its subsidiaries, provides mobile and PC web browsers. The company offers mobile browser products, such as Opera Mini, Opera for Android, and Opera Touch; PC browsers, including Opera for Computers and Opera GX; Opera News, a personalized news aggregation app; and Okash, a microfinance app. It operates in India, Ireland, Kenya, Russia, and internationally. The company was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway. As of January 13, 2021, Opera Limited (NasdaqGS : OPRA) operates as subsidiary of Kunlun Tech Limited.

PEXIP.OL.summary: Pexip Holding ASA, a technology company that delivers a video-first meeting platform. Its platform simplifies video communication across borders, businesses, and platforms, enabling everyone to be seen, heard, and included. The company offers self-hosted and as-a-service deployment options for enterprise video conferencing built on the Pexip Infinity technology; and provides interoperability, including Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business, Google Hangouts Gateway interop, video system device registration, and a world-class meeting and calling service. The company has operations in the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas. Pexip Holding ASA was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

PLT.OL.summary: poLight ASA develops photographic lens for consumer devices and industrial applications. Its lens replicates the lens of the human eye enabling the implementation of autofocus functions for various applications. The company's product portfolio includes Tunable Optical Lens (TLens) products for front and back camera phones; wearables, including AR/VR devices; tablet PCs; HD video cameras; drones; handheld devices; and barcode readers, as well for industry applications, such as medical and retail. It also offers ASIC drivers that control the supply of variable voltage to TLens products and makes them to change focus. It has operations in Europe, Asia, and the United States. poLight ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Horten, Norway.

PMG.OL.summary: Play Magnus AS operates in the chess industry worldwide. The company engages in the development of chess related applications, content, and events. It offers e-learning and entertainment services under the chess24, Chessable, CoChess, the Play Magnus App Suite, and the Champions Chess Tour brands. It also organizes chess competitions through online. The company was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

PXPHF.summary: Pexip Holding ASA, a technology company that delivers a video-first meeting platform. Its platform simplifies video communication across borders, businesses, and platforms, enabling everyone to be seen, heard, and included. The company offers self-hosted and as-a-service deployment options for enterprise video conferencing built on the Pexip Infinity technology; and provides interoperability, including Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business, Google Hangouts Gateway interop, video system device registration, and a world-class meeting and calling service. The company has operations in the Asia Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas. Pexip Holding ASA was founded in 2011 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

RECSI.OL.summary: REC Silicon ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells silicon materials for the solar and electronics industries worldwide. It offers various solar grade polysilicon for solar applications, including granular polysilicon, Siemens rod sections, chunks, chips, and fines. The company also provides electronic grade polysilicon comprising TearDrop, as-grown Siemens rods, rod sections, chunks, and chips for use in Czochralski monocrystalline ingot/wafer manufacturing for the semiconductor industry, as well as other electronic market segments, such as optics and microelectromechanical systems; and float zone polysilicon. In addition, it offers silicon gases consisting of silane, dichlorosilane, monochlorosilane, disilane, and polysilanes. The company was formerly known as Renewable Energy Corporation ASA and changed its name to REC Silicon ASA in October 2013. REC Silicon ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

RNWEF.summary: REC Silicon ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells silicon materials for the solar and electronics industries worldwide. It offers various solar grade polysilicon for solar applications, including granular polysilicon, Siemens rod sections, chunks, chips, and fines. The company also provides electronic grade polysilicon comprising TearDrop, as-grown Siemens rods, rod sections, chunks, and chips for use in Czochralski monocrystalline ingot/wafer manufacturing for the semiconductor industry, as well as other electronic market segments, such as optics and microelectromechanical systems; and float zone polysilicon. In addition, it offers silicon gases consisting of silane, dichlorosilane, monochlorosilane, disilane, and polysilanes. The company was formerly known as Renewable Energy Corporation ASA and changed its name to REC Silicon ASA in October 2013. REC Silicon ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

RNWEY.summary: REC Silicon ASA, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells silicon materials for the solar and electronics industries worldwide. It offers various solar grade polysilicon for solar applications, including granular polysilicon, Siemens rod sections, chunks, chips, and fines. The company also provides electronic grade polysilicon comprising TearDrop, as-grown Siemens rods, rod sections, chunks, and chips for use in Czochralski monocrystalline ingot/wafer manufacturing for the semiconductor industry, as well as other electronic market segments, such as optics and microelectromechanical systems; and float zone polysilicon. In addition, it offers silicon gases consisting of silane, dichlorosilane, monochlorosilane, disilane, and polysilanes. The company was formerly known as Renewable Energy Corporation ASA and changed its name to REC Silicon ASA in October 2013. REC Silicon ASA was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

SIKRI.OL.summary: Sikri Holding AS provides case processing, and document management and archiving solutions to the public sector in Norway. Its products include Elements Sak-Arkiv, a case archive system for the management of public services; Elements eByggesak, a case management tool specially adapted for construction case processing; and Elements RiskManager, an electronic quality system that supports the business with quality and management processes, non-conformance management, notifications, and risk assessments for both the public and private sectors. The company's products also comprise Elements Cloud that supports external login, as well as integrates login solutions in the market, such as ADFS and SAML-based identity solutions; and Elements Lekdommer, a web-based solution for municipalities in connection with the election, updating, and exemption treatment of co-judges in the district court and co-judges and storage members in the storage court. In addition, it offers courses and training, consulting, and support, as well as provides personal counseling of key resources. The company was founded in 2000 and is based in Lysaker, Norway.

SKI.OL.summary: Skitude Holding AS provides digital and mobile platforms for the monitoring, gamification, and sharing of skiing, snowboarding, and other outdoor activity experiences. It connects skiers and outdoor enthusiasts with mountain resorts through a range of smartphone apps, access to ski resorts through Skitude Instant Access, and the purchase of ski passes and other ski resort services. The company was founded in 2016 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

TECH.OL.summary: Techstep ASA provides digital workplace services in Norway and Sweden. It offers mobile hardware, service, support, and mobility consultancy services; and software as a service telecom expense management modules. The company also provides industry-leading cloud-based PBX solutions and enterprise mobility management services, including mobile security, system design, implementation, and mobile device management. Techstep ASA is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

TFECF.summary: Thin Film Electronics ASA designs, develops, and produces ultrathin energy storage solutions for wearable devices, connected sensors, and other applications. Its solid-state lithium battery technology enables it to produce rechargeable batteries with high energy densities and long product lifetimes. The company was founded in 2005 is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

TFECY.summary: Thin Film Electronics ASA designs, develops, and produces ultrathin energy storage solutions for wearable devices, connected sensors, and other applications. Its solid-state lithium battery technology enables it to produce rechargeable batteries with high energy densities and long product lifetimes. The company was founded in 2005 is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

THIN.OL.summary: Thin Film Electronics ASA designs, develops, and produces ultrathin energy storage solutions for wearable devices, connected sensors, and other applications. Its solid-state lithium battery technology enables it to produce rechargeable batteries with high energy densities and long product lifetimes. The company was founded in 2005 is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

VOLUE.OL.summary: Volue AS offers digital platforms and solutions to solve the transition from fossil to renewable energy production worldwide. The company offers software, insights, and services for energy producers and energy traders for forecasting, optimization, production planning, and energy trading; tools that enable grid companies to design, maintain, control, analyze, and monitor the power grid; and flexible solutions for digital water management and helps automate processes and machines for the construction industry. It also provides solutions and technology for the municipalities, water, infrastructure construction, defense, transport, maritime, and offshore industries. The company was founded in 2020 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

WSTEP.OL.summary: Webstep ASA, together with its subsidiaries, provides information technology (IT) consultancy services to public and private businesses in Norway and Sweden. The company offers digitalization, cloud migration and integration, Internet of Things, machine learning, robotics, and analytics. It also provides cloud computing and infrastructure, security and mobility, sensor technology, product and service development, enterprise user experience, Web analysis, designing, Amazon Web, Azure, big data, prediction, AI, predictive modelling, hackathon, business analysis, and search engine optimization services, as well as tech advisory and management solutions. It serves customers in agriculture and food, banking and financial, oil and offshore, power and energy, telecom, and software industries. The company was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.
